page.title: 02Animals of the Area
page.content: The high moorland is 1341 feet above sea level.The animals that live at this height are rabbits,foxes,hares, Welsh mountain ponies, and Welsh mountain sheep.In the drier parts, living under stones are ants,beetles, spiders and worms.The grazing animals are Welsh Black Cattle,mountain ponies and sheep.The birds that live here are skylarks,meadow pipits,crows,ravens, magpies,snipe,lapwing and curlew. In the ponds there are newts,frogs, water snails,pond skaters,mosquitos, and other water insects.The fish that live in the large ponds are roach, perch,bream,chub,carp,gudgeon and stickleback.One of the rare birds to visit is the sandpiper.
